data.title: Beautiful Bexar County Courthouse
data.text:
The old courthouse is the largest and oldest continuously operating historic courthouse in Texas designed in Romanesque style by  James Riely Gordon distinguish itself from all the other buildings because of the  dark orange reddish color is located across from the Main plaza where the San Fernando Cathedral is also located , 
started in 1892 and finished in 1897 and is one of the most important landmarks in San Antonio..

data.title: I love this area of downtown
data.text: This is a beautiful area of downtown and not far from the river walk. Parking can be tricky at times but worth it. There is a family park not to far from the courthouse. I recommend taking an afternoon to explore. Bring cash for parking

data.title: History of justice in a renovated courthouse
data.text: The Hidalgo Foundation has renovated parts of the Bexar County Courthouse making it a bit of a museum and a courthouse.  Cases are still heard here, but the details of the interior make it a great place to stop and look around when visiting San Antonio. Ask to see the Presiding Courtroom which has been redone recently.

data.title: Family Couet
data.text: It is very confusing to get around. Thank goodness our attorney met us and guided us.  The courthouse is very clean.

data.title: Jury Duty....Food is satisfactory...seating terrible!
data.text: Jury duty is exactly that...our service to our community.  We were promised 90 minutes for lunch, but I was selected to a jury selection right before lunchtime.  The bailiff decided to give us only 45 mins for lunch (Booo!) so our only option was to eat at the cafeteria there.  I was surprised at the selection of hot and cold entrees, but ultimately went for meatloaf and cornbread.  Wish I stick with the cornbread only, it was delicious!  The meatloaf was almost undercooked and felt like a brick in my stomach.  The worst part of the cafeteria was the seating, not enough for 90% strangers to sit together.  If I were in charge of layout, I would set it up similar to an airport, with bar seating to allow customers to sit next to one another, but not facing each other.  It allows for strangers to choose to engage or not, versus having to strike up a conversation with a perfect stranger for the price of a seat.  For all you extroverts....this is no big deal...for me...yes I choose to sit in anonymity.  I moved out into the courtyard with my meal and endured intermittent raindrops for price of solitude.  In summary, find a seat fast...or get ready to make a friend for lunch.

data.title: Very large, complex courthouse
data.text: My work is courthouse research throughout the State of Texas, so I have seen many.  The Bexar County Courthouse and Justice Center are connected by a basement tunnel.  Many of the offices you would think should be located within close proximity to one another are not and it is pretty challenging to navigate your way around.  There aren't many directionals for the newcomer. Be prepared to ask for directions.

data.title: classic Texas 1800's courthouse architecture
data.text: Nice old building.  Particularly good for night time photography subject.  Christmas season it has special night lighting .

data.title: Beautiful at night
data.text: I passed by the courthouse when walking to the San Fernando Cathedral. The historic building looks beautiful in the street lights.

data.title: Very professional, courteous
data.text: The building was very clean, the updates are very nice. Court rooms are clean. Processing is through leagal system was quick and done quit well. The buildings were clean, the restrooms were clean, vending machines were fully stocked incase you had to spend extended time.

data.title: Interesting Historic Building
data.text: The Bexar County Courthouse has undergone several renovations to accommodate the business conducted there, but has maintained its historic charm.

data.title: Courthouse Trip.
data.text: Nice older venue with a real courthouse feel.  If you are into courthouse visits, this one doesn't disappoint.

data.title: Nice Architecture ion the Middle of the Plaza
data.text:
Not sure if you can go into his building or not, but the lovely architecture certainly makes you want to take pictures.  Against a perfect blue sky, you will have wonderful photos of colonial design.  The building is red/pink sandstone, and it is IMMENSE.  It makes you feel so small!

Had we had more time, my husband and I certinaly would have gone inside to see if the interior were as spectacular as the exterior.

This building is the focal point of a lovely town square, complete with working fountain.  It is quite amazing to see such an old structure in such good condition.

data.title: Needed Guidance
data.text: I had documents that needed to be checked for accuracy of real property legal descriptions contained therein.  Got directions to get to the Deed Office and the personnel got the filed copy of the deed description and verified the descriptions were accurate.  Was directed to the Deed Filing office and was easily able to get the deed documents filed.  Nearby parking was difficult and expensive.  Best to get the address for court house parking and park there.

data.title: The Red Courthouse
data.text: The red court house is old and nice. Inside takes you back decades to what use to be. The courthouse also has a restaurant inside in the basement that makes great tasting old fashion burgers that you must try!

data.title: Great place to see on a guided tour.
data.text: A beautiful, historic working building with an amazing history.  You need to be on a guided tour to understand how part of the building was designed to publicly hang people.  Parking is difficult to find, and we did not find that there were any tours inside the building.

data.title: Impressive red sandstone building
data.text: The County Courthouse stands in the heart of San Antonio, in a beautiful square with a neoclassic fountain. The building is massive and impressive, probably intended to make you feel small in front of the authorities.

data.title: Bexar County Courthouse  - Great Historic Courthouse!
data.text: I was walking downtown San Antonio and made it over to the Bexar County Courthouse  - Great Historic Courthouse! What a unique building, red Texas limestone, wow!

data.title: Courthouse of the fourth largest county in Texas
data.text: As a tourist, this building along with it's fountain is eye catching from right across the Historical Main Plaza. It stands to be the Bexar Courthouse of the fourth largest County in Texas and the 19th largest County nationally. The building was built right before the 20th century and designed in a Romanesque Revival Style.

data.title: Hidden gem???
data.text: We didn't know this was here! Walking around the riverwalk we literally saw it and strolled across to see what it was. A fabulous find! I could almost imagine the scenes of days gone by when looking at this fabulous structure. Perhaps more signage from the river????

data.title: History in front of You!
data.text: This building is one of the most beautifully constructed buildings in San Antonio.  Don't miss if you have a few minutes to see a classic stone building of the old west.
